links.title: Downward Pressure Mounting
links.description: The main U.S. stock market indexes extended their Tuesday's losses, as they closed 0.2-1.0% lower yesterday. The S&P 500 index lost 0.6% following Tuesday's bounce off resistance level at 2,800. However, it remained at the support level of last Friday's daily gap up. It currently trades 4.6% below January 26 record high of 2,872.87.

links.title: Ex-Apple chief: Centene partnership with pharmacy start-up will drive better care with lower costs
links.description: The holy grail in health care now is to harness patient data to improve patient care while also cutting costs. When it comes to tackling pharmacy benefits, the former CEO of Apple says real change has to go beyond just cutting fees.

links.title: Toys 'R' Us to close US stores, leaving void for toy lovers
links.description: Toys 'R' Us Inc, the iconic toy retailer, is shuttering its 735 U.S. stores after failing to find a buyer or reach a deal to restructure billions in debt, putting about 30,000 people out of jobs.

messages.body: $AAPL “No-name brand headphones at high prices” sums up the current state of the USB-C headphone market.
$AAPL tech darling Essential Phone doesn’t provide USB-C headphones in the box either, and they charge $99 for their earbuds.
$AAPL The cheapest Pixel-compatible USB-C headphones in Google’s store are the Libratone Q Adapt earphones, and they cost $149. Libratone?
In the box. And additional $AAPL OEM 3.5mm to Lightning adapters are just $9. The Verge calls this "user hostile"
$AAPL Apple provides a set of wired Lighting headphones in every iPhone box. Tech pundits favorite the Google Pixel?
$AAPL Customers are increasingly explaining about their experiences at the tech meccas. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-apple-inc-aapl-stores-hit-with-dreaded-comparison-to-visiting/

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stores Hit With Dreaded Comparison To Visiting DMV
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has achieved smashing success with its Apple Stores, but some chinks in the armor are beginning to emerge. Complaints are growing among customers, and it's gotten to the point that a dreaded label has been bestowed on the tech giant's retail experience.
